Sequence Information.Peptide Name: HD-5(7-32) (protease-cleaved active fragment, natural AMPs; humans; primates, mammals, animals; UCLL1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 81.2% similarity toHD-5.  It is assumed that a similar process occurs in vivo under a reduced condition.Activity: Highly active against various commensal bacteria B. subtilis 168trpC; B breve, B. lonqum, B. adolescentis Ni3,29c, B. vulqatus, E. coli MC1000, L. fermentum, L. rhamnosus, L. salivarius, and S. solivarius salivarius. In addition, it is active against A. baumannii 4-MRGN (MIC 25 uM), K.pneumoniae 3-MRGN (inactive), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 50 uM), E. faecium 475747 (MIC 25 uM), and S.aureus USA300 (inactive). The discovery of HD-5 active fragments indicate the complex of host defense peptides and potential role in regulating the microbiome. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Ehmann D, Wendler J, Koeninger L, Larsen IS, Klag T, Berger J, Marette A, Schaller M, Stange EF, Malek NP, Jensen BAH, Wehkamp J.2019
Literature Information.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2019 Feb 26;116(9):3746-3751. doi: 10.1073/pnas.1817376116.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Paneth cell alpha-defensins HD-5 and HD-6 display differential degradation into active antimicrobial fragments
